result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail may be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System;  consecutive to any sentence in being

--The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
Consecutive to: any sentence in being

--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $453 + $435.57 restitution and processing fees, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of civil judgment
--Defendant is to pay $435.57 in restitution plus possessing fees payable to Kwick Trip.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert S Davis

records.addlTxt:
[ae] case called 1:57 PM Defendant Robert S Davis appeared by video, in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze appeared by video for Robert S Davis. ADA Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed to plea/sentencing via video.

ADA Beck requests the Court grant leave to file an Amended Information, the Court grants request.
Service of Amended Information admitted.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations given

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail may be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System;  consecutive to any sentence in being
--0 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is to pay $435.57 in restitution plus possessing fees payable to Kwick Trip.
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $453 + $435.57 restitution and processing fees, The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in entry of civil judgment
--The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.

Appeal Rights given 
Recess: 2:21 pm
Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
w/ elements

[ma] Case called at 3:21 PM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Robert S Davis appeared by zoom from KMCI, in custody.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze appeared by zoom for Robert S Davis.  Attorney Michael Witt appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Broze indicates that it was the intent to proceed to disposition today, but paperwork was unable to be executed at no fault of the Defense; requests adjournment.
--no objection from ADA Witt

recess: 3:26pm

[MK] case called at 2:30pm
Defendant Robert S Davis appears by videoconference from Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Abigail. Broze appears by videoconference from a separate location.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds the video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Broze requests that the case be scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing, indicating that the Defense is requesting to appear by video for the next hearing.  
The Court verifies with Mr. Davis that he understands he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing, and he is asking to appear remotely for the next hearing. 
recess 2:34pm.

NEXT:  Plea and Sentencing on August 15th at 2:30pm with appearances by Zoom/video-conferencing

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:16am 
Defendant Robert S Davis in court, in custody, with Attorney Brandon Carlson.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Davis waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess  9:22am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 6th at 9:00am, (2) Status Conference is to be scheduled by the JA (due to need to coordinate the appearance of Mr. Davis with his custody-facility; if Mr. Davis has been transferred to DCI by the next hearing date, then the hearing should be scheduled with Zoom appearances to accommodate Defense counsel)
Atty Broze
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 9:07am 
Defendant Robert S Davis does not appear. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today.  ADA Witt indicates that the State cancelled its witnesses after receiving the information from JESO Sgt. Kanters that the Waukesha County Jail would not approve the pick up/transport of Mr. Davis for today's hearing. 
The Court notes that it signed an Order to Produce on April 20th and the Court was informed that upon the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office communication by email with the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department it was learned that the WCSD would not approve the pick up of Mr. Davis. 
The Court will have its Judicial Assistant email the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department regarding the newly scheduled date. The Court will have a writ prepared today. The Court orders that the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department will turn over Mr. Davis for the June 17th hearing date. If there is some reason that the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department will be unable to do so, that agency can apply for leave from the Court. Otherwise if Mr. Davis is not made available, the Court will issue an Order to Show Cause with a hearing date set. 
recess 9:11am. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on June 17th at 9:00am
Order to Produce
from Sgt. Kanters re: 5/20/22 Wrt
certified copy to DAs office (4/20/22--ma)
Order to Produce
Scheduling Order
from Waukesha Co Jail advising defendant refused to sign bond

--no presence at any Kwick Trip in Jefferson County Wisconsin

[ae] case called 11:13 AM Defendant Robert S Davis appeared by telephone in custody from Waukesha County Jail.  ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no presence at any Kwick Trip in Jefferson County Wisconsin
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 11:18 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 5/20/22 at 8:30 am [Clerk is to notify SPD that defendant would like paperwork mailed to him]
